title: 16. Errors
content:
## Logging Error

- use the keyword `new`
- Will not prevent the program to stop

:::important
this doesn't cause the program to stop
:::

```js 
// Write your code below:
console.log(new Error('User missing name'))


console.log('Will logging the error stop our program from running?');


```

![](image-l59e5dhv.png)


## Throwing an Error

- use the keyword `throw`
- Will prevent the program to stop


```js 
let outcome = 0
if (outcome === 0){
    throw Error('Something wrong happened');
}
else{
    console.log("fine")
}

```

![](image-l59efelt.png)


# Try and Catch
